bill.title: An act relating to promoting workforce development
bill.description: An act relating to promoting workforce development

committee.name: Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs

referrals.name: Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs

history.action: Read First Time and referred to the Committee on Commerce and Economic Development
Notice Calendar: Favorable with amendment
Referred to Committee on Ways and Means per Rule 35(a)
Referred to Committee on Appropriations per Rule 35(a)
Notice Calendar: Favorable with amendment
Action Calendar: Favorable with amendment
Rep. Kimbell of Woodstock moved to postpone action until March 24, 2022 which was agreed to
Action Calendar: Favorable with amendment
Read Second time
Rep. Kimbell of Woodstock reported for the Committee on Commerce and Economic Development
Rep. Till of Jericho recommended for the Committee on Ways and Means
Rep. Toleno of Brattleboro recommended for the Committee on Appropriations

Rep. Kimbell of Woodstock, Marcotte of Coventry, Dickinson of St. Albans Town, Jerome of Brandon, Kascenska of Burke, Kitzmiller of Montpelier, Laroche of Franklin, Mulvaney-Stanak of Burlington, Nicoll of Ludlow, Nigro of Bennington, and White of Bethel moved to substitute an amendment for the report of the Committee on Appropriations
Which was agreed to
Report of Committee on Ways and Means withdrawn
Report of the Committee on Commerce and Economic Development amended as recommended by the Committee on Appropriations as substituted
Report of Committee on Commerce and Economic Development as amended agreed to
Third Reading ordered
Action Calendar: Third reading
Action Calendar: Amendment offered by Rep Cordes of Lincoln
Rep. Cordes of Lincoln moved to amend the bill which was agreed to
Read Third time
Rep. Marcotte of Coventry demanded yeas and nays
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 70 of 139 to Pass -- Yeas = 139, Nays = 0
Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs

votes.desc: Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 70 of 139 to Pass -- Yeas = 139, Nays = 0
